comments:
This class is an introduction to the problems that are facing urban public schools in America.  The class is focused on urban schooling. Historical, social and cultural contexts of urban education are analyzed as are philosophical and theoretical perspectives about the need for education.  Recent reforms and policies are also investigated. 
Students felt that the material in this class was very engaging and interesting.  However, students also felt that “There was a lot of reading to do that sometimes it was strenuous.” Overall, students felt that the “course content was great” and “discussions were amazing and readings were valuable.” 
Students were very impressed with Professor Batch’s teaching style. Students were satisfied with her choice of readings for the course. Many students’s felt that the teacher and the readings really “opened their eyes.” 
The students who took this class were upperclassman and underclassman who took the class to fulfill sector and major requirements.
